2021-03-28T16:58:35Z: We'll see you in a few weeks' time for the *checks notes* Pirelli Gran Premio del Made in Italy e dell'Emilia Romagna - ie, the next race at Imola. See you then!
2021-03-28T16:57:49Z: ...and here's the race report from a thrilling Bahrain Grand Prix: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/bahrain-gp-hamilton-holds-off-verstappen-to-win-epic-race/5958416/
2021-03-28T16:42:41Z: Norris bags fourth, as Perez cleared Leclerc for fifth. Ricciardo gets seventh, Sainz eighth, Tsunoda bags a pair of points for ninth, and Stroll completes the top 10.
2021-03-28T16:41:44Z: That was one hell of a battle - and Bottas compounds Verstappen's misery by stealing the fastest lap after a late stop!
2021-03-28T16:41:03Z: Tsunoda has stolen ninth place on the final lap from Stroll! What a race for the F1 debutant! It wasn't caught on the TV with the action ahead on the final lap, but the Japanese driver had been stalking the Aston Martin over the closing stages and got the move done at the start of the final lap.
2021-03-28T16:40:28Z: And after all of that, Lewis Hamilton hangs on from Max Verstappen to win the Bahrain Grand Prix!
2021-03-28T16:40:04Z: Verstappen is fast running out of opportunities here - and Hamilton looks like he might have weathered the storm...
2021-03-28T16:39:18Z: Verstappen got back within a second of Hamilton this time around, but the Mercedes driver is working really hard to deploy his ERS at the right time...
2021-03-28T16:38:21Z: Gasly has also retired from this race with two laps to go. So Schumacher is up to P16.
2021-03-28T16:38:18Z: Hamilton's managed to find enough of a buffer to evade DRS that time around! Resolute in defence here.
2021-03-28T16:37:23Z: Further back Latifi has retired from the race according to the timing screen. Not clear if he has had an issue but it promotes Schumacher up to P17.
2021-03-28T16:36:40Z: Verstappen gets DRS again, but can't make the move this time around! Hamilton, somehow, is just hanging on here...
2021-03-28T16:35:32Z: But Verstappen gives the place back to Hamilton, having dunked his car too far off the road!
2021-03-28T16:34:56Z: Here we go, Verstappen's got DRS...he dives around the outside at T1, Hamilton holds, but the Dutchman cruises around the outside at Turn 4 to grab the lead!
2021-03-28T16:34:17Z: Perez is ahead of Leclerc, which hasn't been shown on the TV yet due to the action for the lead, but we can confirm Perez is fifth.
2021-03-28T16:33:24Z: Verstappen can smell Hamilton's cologne now, but he's just a little bit far off into turn 1 and 4 this time around.
2021-03-28T16:32:32Z: Vettel has been given a 10-second time penalty for his earlier clash with Ocon. Vettel is currently P14 so that's effectively ended his faint hopes of points today.
2021-03-28T16:32:21Z: Hamilton goes wide into turn 10, which brings Verstappen even closer - this might be a DRS range next time we hit the straight.
2021-03-28T16:31:22Z: The other Red Bull, Perez, is also chasing for a position. Perez is within two seconds of Leclerc who holds fifth place.
2021-03-28T16:27:38Z: Vettel and Ocon have got a little in the way of the chasing Verstappen, which helped Hamilton a little - but the Red Bull's still just 2.4s off now.
2021-03-28T16:26:35Z: The Vettel and Ocon clash has been put under investigation by the stewards. Vettel could be in trouble here.
2021-03-28T16:26:29Z: Once again, we've got the insightful overtake-o-meter predicting a lead showdown in five laps' time. Once again, a medium difficulty challenge - down to the nearest nano-difficulty.
2021-03-28T16:25:01Z: Double misery for Aston Martin as a lap later Sainz sails ahead of Stroll into eighth place at Turn 1. Easy as you like.
2021-03-28T16:24:03Z: Ocon, going around the outside of Vettel, was hit in the rear by the German who locked up under braking. Vettel, with front wing damage, over team radio says that the French driver changed lines under braking, but it didn't really look like that.
2021-03-28T16:23:32Z: The lead gap is now within four seconds, and we've 10 laps left.
2021-03-28T16:22:20Z: Ah, Vettel and Ocon tangle at Turn 1 which sends both drivers spinning off. That allows Giovinazzi to overtake both of them before they get going again.
2021-03-28T16:20:54Z: That didn't take long, Perez makes light work of passing Ricciardo to take sixth place using DRS at Turn 1.
2021-03-28T16:20:00Z: Perez watch: He's within one second of Ricciardo who is running in sixth place.
2021-03-28T16:17:01Z: The latest pitstop shuffling and Alonso's exit has seen Tsunoda rise up to 10th place, around three seconds up on Raikkonen. That'll be a fun fight for the final points place.
2021-03-28T16:16:37Z: A 1m33.228s for Verstappen that time around. Game on.
2021-03-28T16:16:17Z: Verstappen's absolutely flying now. Hamilton's race engineer Bono says that Verstappen will catch him in 10 laps' time - but at this rate, it might be a bit shorter than that.
2021-03-28T16:14:43Z: But Stroll's hold on seventh doesn't last long as Perez charges by a lap later with the aid of DRS down the main straight.
2021-03-28T16:14:29Z: Verstappen pits! It's a 1.9s stop, and is now given the all clear to go and hunt Hamilton down. He's got 8s to find.
2021-03-28T16:13:41Z: Here's Perez pitting for the mediums, and he returns to the circuit fractions ahead of Stroll there. But Stroll drives around the outside at Turn 4 and gets P7!
2021-03-28T16:11:58Z: Here's Sainz in to pit, and he'll come out ninth - behind Stroll.
2021-03-28T16:08:30Z: Sainz the one out of sync in the midfield fight, yet to make a second stop, which sees him currently up in fifth place ahead of Norris and Leclerc.
2021-03-28T16:07:01Z: Hamilton is told to run in the low 1m34s, and did a 1m34.665s on the previous lap. He'll presumably have to take these hards to the end.
2021-03-28T16:04:49Z: Norris is coming in too from third for hard tyres, which will elevate Bottas back up to third.
2021-03-28T16:04:05Z: Bad news for Alonso on his F1 comeback race. He's retiring from the Bahrain GP with brake problems at the end of lap 33. He joins Mazepin for an early bath.
2021-03-28T16:03:26Z: Leclerc and Ricciardo come in to stop, taking on hard tyres.
2021-03-28T16:01:58Z: Perez climbs up to sixth getting ahead of Ricciardo now, so the strong fightback continues from the Mexican on his Red Bull debut.
2021-03-28T16:00:06Z: Bottas pits, and it's a disaster - the right front is slow off, as Mercedes struggles with another Bahrain pitstop! Bottas falls behind Norris and Leclerc, with Ricciardo now chasing him.
2021-03-28T15:57:56Z: Stroll makes his second stop looking to pull off an undercut in the fight for seventh. As he comes out of the pits, the TV cameras catch a right tussle between Vettel and Latifi in the background, with the German taking P17.
2021-03-28T15:56:19Z: Hamilton elects to respond to Verstappen by pitting - those hard tyres didn't last long, apparently! All roads point to a three stop, or he'll try and do half the race on that set...
2021-03-28T15:55:03Z: Make that two seconds, Verstappen's eating at the gap now with some excellent pace.
2021-03-28T15:53:51Z: Verstappen's got the gap down within 3s to Hamilton now, so it's still very much game on. Bottas is losing ground to the front two, now 4.5s off Verstappen.
2021-03-28T15:53:32Z: Well, it was for a lap or two. Perez charges up the inside of Stroll at Turn 1 to take the place at the start of lap 27.
2021-03-28T15:52:29Z: Friends reunited as Perez hounds ex-team-mate Stroll for seventh place. This could be fun.
2021-03-28T15:50:54Z: Vettel finally pits on lap 25 to take on fresh hard tyres. He comes out in P17 ahead of only Schumacher and Gasly, who are both struggling for pace after their respective offs.
2021-03-28T15:49:29Z: That being said, the gap to Hamilton and Verstappen is a little static at this point at 3.8s. The Red Bull driver needs to get his skates on.
2021-03-28T15:47:48Z: AWS's Overtake-o-meter has Verstappen pulling up to Hamilton in six laps' time - with a medium spicyness of overtakeness. I guess, I don't know how it works, but I assume it's basically the Nando's scale.
2021-03-28T15:47:06Z: Vettel's tyres must be crying enough now as he locks up and drops places to Perez, Alonso and Raikkonen, to put the German down to P12.
2021-03-28T15:45:21Z: A lap later Alonso dives up the inside of Vettel at Turn 1 but gets his braking wrong, which not only allows Vettel back through but also gives Sainz the chance to mug them both. Which he does. Ole.
2021-03-28T15:45:04Z: Verstappen was a full second quicker than Hamilton on that previous lap, lead stands at 4.2s now.
2021-03-28T15:43:48Z: Bottas has word from the top - Toto Wolff tells him to hunt down Verstappen. Perez, meanwhile, stopped and now sits P12.
2021-03-28T15:43:06Z: Vettel duly makes the overtake for Stroll relatively straightforward at Turn 1 before shutting the door on the chasing Alonso and Sainz. Good teamwork by the new Aston Martin driver.
2021-03-28T15:41:38Z: Ricciardo darts past the yet-to-pit Vettel for seventh and now the German has team-mate Stroll on his tail, who heads a mini train containing a pair of Spaniards in Alonso and Sainz.
2021-03-28T15:39:59Z: Bottas is right on Perez's tail now, as the Mexican has much older tyres. Perez tries to hold the line into Turn 11, but can't keep the Mercedes behind.
2021-03-28T15:39:41Z: Despite jumping ahead of Stroll in the pitstops, Alonso is now behind the Aston Martin driver again with the pair running in the final two points-paying places.
2021-03-28T15:38:55Z: Verstappen comes in to pit, coming out behind Hamilton - who takes the lead! The Dutchman's on mediums, with Hamilton on the hard tyre.
2021-03-28T15:37:32Z: On his worn tyres, Vettel duly loses two places in half a lap to Norris and Leclerc to drop to seventh place. Remember that Vettel started the race last on the grid.
2021-03-28T15:37:11Z: Bottas now pits, swapping mediums for hard tyres, and he comes out behind Perez in fourth.
2021-03-28T15:35:40Z: Sainz pits from fourth, elevating Perez into the top four.
2021-03-28T15:35:03Z: Verstappen stays out, although Hamilton's really making hay on those hard tyres. The pit strategy battle thingy says Hamilton would pass if Verstappen pits now - so Red Bull keeping its powder dry for now.
2021-03-28T15:32:53Z: Ricciardo also stops, losing ground to Alonso as Stroll is now trying to clear the McLaren driver.
2021-03-28T15:30:57Z: Alonso's early stop triggers a pitlane party as Norris, Leclerc, Stroll and Giovinazzi all pit a lap later. The stops have seen Alonso jump Stroll to regain a place.
2021-03-28T15:31:02Z: Norris comes in to pit from fourth, taking the medium compound tyres. We missed the getaway, but he rejoins ahead of Leclerc who also stopped.
2021-03-28T15:29:44Z: Norris has dropped Leclerc now, which has brought Ricciardo right behind the Ferrari driver. The camera cut away mid-battle, but there wasn't a change in position either way...
2021-03-28T15:29:09Z: Alonso, who started on the softs, pits on lap 12 to take a fresh set of mediums. The Alpine driver returns to the action in P17.
2021-03-28T15:28:52Z: The battle at the front is separated by 1.8s - Verstappen over Hamilton, with Bottas a further five seconds back.
2021-03-28T15:28:04Z: Perez is up to P12 after getting ahead of Ocon and he is now hunting down Raikkonen. A Red Bull charging through the pack feels very 2020.
2021-03-28T15:28:02Z: Norris hasn't been able to scamper up the road from Leclerc, which is keeping the Ferrari driver's foot in the battle for fourth with DRS.
2021-03-28T15:26:39Z: The clash involving Gasly at Turn 4 - when he lost his front wing - will not be investigated by the stewards. Nor will the battle between Norris and Leclerc earlier. As you were.
2021-03-28T15:25:13Z: Stroll, whose Aston Martin appears unaffected by that close attention from Sainz earlier, gets by Alonso at the first corner to claim seventh place.
2021-03-28T15:24:37Z: Norris stuffs it past Leclerc into Turn 1 this time around, and holds the place into the following DRS stretch. Nice and clean.
2021-03-28T15:24:07Z: Perez, who went from last place to win the Sakhir GP a few months back, is already up to P13 having started from the pitlane. Can lightning strike twice in Bahrain?
2021-03-28T15:23:23Z: Here's Norris on Leclerc, grabbing DRS - but can't clear the Ferrari into turn 1! He tried again into turn 4, hanging on around the outside, but couldn't keep with him into the following corners.
2021-03-28T15:22:47Z: That young whippersnapper Alonso has kept his Alpine's nose clean amid the action and is up to seventh behind the two McLarens. TV replays catch a clash between Sainz and Stroll on lap 4, with the Spaniard banging against the Aston Martin at Turn 8.
2021-03-28T15:20:51Z: Verstappen seems to have an issue with his differential, but he's just logged the fastest lap - a 1m35.982s.
2021-03-28T15:19:34Z: The incident involving Gasly at Turn 4 has been noted, according to race control, with the French driver still in the race but down in P19 having pitted for a new front wing and fresh hard tyres.
2021-03-28T15:19:36Z: Bottas cruises past Leclerc on the DRS into turn 1, but Leclerc gets a run into turn 4! Bottas holds third, but Leclerc gave that a good go...
2021-03-28T15:18:07Z: Tsunoda also lost a handful of places in the bumping and barging and is down in P16 for AlphaTauri. Vettel has profited in all of it and is P14 right behind Russell in P13.
2021-03-28T15:17:10Z: And it's a VSC now! This is quite something...
2021-03-28T15:16:50Z: Messy restart in the midfield, as Schumacher spins off at Turn 4, while Gasly has lost his front wing in a battle with Ricciardo.
2021-03-28T15:16:18Z: Gasly's lost his front wing at turn 7!
2021-03-28T15:15:53Z: Verstappen backed everyone up, trying to deny Hamilton the tow, and that let Leclerc trickle past Bottas and give Hamilton a bit of a run for his money!
2021-03-28T15:14:56Z: Is Perez going to do this from the back again?
2021-03-28T15:14:23Z: While all that was going on at the start, Perez did start the race from the pitlane and is duly in last place but right on the rear wing of Schumacher.
2021-03-28T15:13:49Z: Safety car coming in at the end of the lap.
2021-03-28T15:13:34Z: No changes among the top five, although Norris snuck past Ricciardo in those opening corners. Meanwhile, Verstappen is told not to worry too much about his weird throttle.
2021-03-28T15:12:55Z: TV replays show Mazepin crashing all on his own, chasing the back of the pack at the start. He lights up the rears and gets it all out of shape exiting the third corner and that creates a meeting with the barrier.
2021-03-28T15:10:34Z: Horrible deja vu moment of seeing a Haas going off at Turn 3 on the opening lap of the Bahrain GP. Thankfully Mazepin is OK and out of the car, but his F1 debut is over.
2021-03-28T15:08:51Z: A Haas has gone off at Turn 3! It is Mazepin, who went off to the left of the track. The safety car is out.
2021-03-28T15:09:00Z: Verstappen holds the line into the first corner, as Leclerc is hounding Bottas!
2021-03-28T15:08:14Z: After all that, we're away for the Bahrain Grand Prix!
2021-03-28T15:06:57Z: We're coming round again, hopefully to kick the race off once more...we'll now run to 56 laps.
2021-03-28T15:06:31Z: Perez's Red Bull appears to shut off completely on the formation lap and he crawls to a halt. After a shutdown and restart, Perez gets going again and heads to the end of the pitlane, where he will start the race.
2021-03-28T15:05:39Z: An aborted start, then, as Perez stopped towards the end of the lap...
2021-03-28T15:04:54Z: Oh no, that's not how you want to start the season. Perez has stopped on the formation lap!
2021-03-28T15:03:29Z: The cars begin to line up on the grid...
2021-03-28T15:01:00Z: We're on the formation lap. The tension is palpable...
2021-03-28T14:59:24Z: A fair mix of tyre strategies. Medium runners are Verstappen, Hamilton, Bottas, Gasly, Perez, Giovinazzi, Tsunoda, Raikkonen, Schumacher, Mazepin and Vettel. Everyone else on softs.
2021-03-28T14:55:48Z: Much like the earlier F2 race, there's a headwind into Turn 1 - so that might make the slipstream a little more potent.
2021-03-28T14:54:25Z: Who wants to know the risk of rain for the race? Any guesses? That's right, a whopping 0%. It's doubtful that anyone's packed a raincoat anyway...
2021-03-28T14:49:40Z: Fingers crossed for an almighty scrap between Verstappen and Hamilton in this race. Turn 1 will be, as ever, absolutely crucial to both...
2021-03-28T14:47:29Z: 15 minutes until we get underway - remember, we no longer start at 10 past! Hopefully we're not struggling too much with the clocks going forward, although I feel like I've been robbed of sleep...
2021-03-28T14:44:42Z: A few changes to the pre-race We Race As One message - it's a lot more open to interpretation this year.
2021-03-28T14:41:51Z: Here's some weather info - it's a much more cool 21 degrees C out there, with a 29.5 degree track temperature.
2021-03-28T14:40:24Z: Vettel, meanwhile, has been shuffled to the back having failed to slow for double-waved yellow flags during Q1. He was due to start P18, so it doesn't make too much difference: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/vettel-receives-grid-penalty-for-bahrain-yellow-flag-infringement/5955370/
2021-03-28T14:38:58Z: A little bit of news so far, as Red Bull have made a few changes - Perez gets a new ECU and battery after Honda found some issues in the data, while Verstappen got a new floor after damage in Q1. Both are penalty free.
2021-03-28T14:35:08Z: Good afternoon everyone! Just over 25 minutes until the 2021 F1 season kicks off with the first race of the season. We're excited - and we hope you are too!
